channel.title: Comments on: SSIS:Multi Instance Management made easy.
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: SQLArcher
item.dc:creator: SQLArcher
item.content:encoded:
This is only to make management and uploading of SSIS packages easier for the DBA who is responsible for managing it.

When you create any connections like a SQL job for instance, it will still have to reference the server where the msdb is located instead of the server where you added the XML entries.

One way to view this XML configuration is to see it as a “central Management Server” for SSIS packages, just a central point of management.

item.title: By: Michael Robey
item.dc:creator: Michael Robey
item.content:encoded:
I have mine seet up this way but how do I use the expression for my connection manager to know which databases to hit. With one instance as the default only I can check the server name and know to connect to that server but with multi instances on a server I don’t know which one to execute.

If I have DEV and UAT as instances I will have the same package on both instances and I don’t want to have to recode the package as it moves up the tier from DEV to UAT and want the package to figure out which tier it is on.

item.title: By: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.dc:creator: Ted Krueger (onpnt)
item.content:encoded:
Great tip! It also still frustrating that the services are not cluster aware. Easy to say it isn’t needed since the services don’t really have a functional impact on “uptime” but a nuisance nonetheless. It is just another thing that is an extra step in HA that probably doesn’t need to be.

The official word on that: http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms345193.aspx
